Entries.default:
"Hold up, lovesome."

Captain 'Sea Wolf' Aeldys, commander of the united Pr√≠ncipi fleet, twirls a small pistol around her trigger finger as she strolls up to you.

Behind her, a bevy of well-armed pirates swoop closer, eager for bloodshed.

"Oh, come now. Did you really think you wouldn't be seeing me again?"

She cocks her head to the side like a curious bird.
"Just words?"
"Now's not a good time."
"Huh?"
"I've got some words for you."
"I know we didn't get a chance to be properly acquainted - not in the way I'd have liked. But that doesn't mean we ought not to tie up loose threads, considering."
"Words, aye. And maybe a bullet or two."
"When is a good time to die, really? Ready or not, Hel's coming for you."
"I'd like to say it's nothing personal. But considering how you've hunted my crews, like a godsdamned shark with a blood-scent, it most assuredly is."
"It's nothing personal, you see."
"There's still time for us to steal whatever doom-causing relic your rogue god's after. Let him try to find it while my fleet sails apart to every end of the ocean."
[Attack] "Get out of my way, pirate."
"I'm going to feed you to the sharks - bit by bit as I hack it off!"
"Ukaizo was built by Huana ancestors. It belongs to them, by rights."
"This territory is under the domain of the Rauatai. Trespassers will be executed."
"If anyone's going to profit off Ukaizo, it's the Vailian Trading Company."
"Ha! And you think that means shit to a pirate? What're you, trying to appeal to my honor, dove?"
"I've never backed down from a threat in my life, dove. If you expect me to fall on my knees, trembling, on account of the military coming for my blood - well, you don't know me at all then, do you?"

"I won't fault you for that line of reasoning. But I'll kill you all the same."

Aeldys grins wildly.
"Walk away now, and I'll let you live."

"Do you really think I'd sail all this way - to the very edge of Eora - just to back down at the cusp of achieving my aim?

"And for what, lovesome? The threat of dying, like pirates tend to do?"
"Surely, we can work something out?"

"Barring that... we'll plunder the lost city of gold and live like royalty right up until the end.

"If it's to be my last life, I'll damn well make it a good one."
"Eothas is going to break the Wheel. It's not some damn trinket, it's bigger than this island."
Heaving a heavy sigh, she rolls her neck on her shoulders.

"Guess that leaves me with the fallthrough option. Kill you, pirate Ukaizo, and make the best of the apocalypse."

Then she aims her gun at your chest.
"No. That won't be happening."
"Fill 'em with lead!"
With a sneer, she signals her crew to fire.

"It's a little late for that, don't you figure?"

She fingers her suolenet as if thinking about it. Then, a curt shake of her head.
"I'll give you one last chance to get acquainted with me though. It'll be through my bullet in your gut as I step over you to plunder the lost city of gold."
"Till the next life - assuming we get one."

"Only ones I honor are the loyal crew members in my vast and ruthless fleet. It's for them I'm obligated to plunder the lost city of gold, you see?

"While you - well, seeing as you're in my way. I figure I'm obligated to murder you."
"Oh, don't give me that look. I'll be sure to pour one out for you while I plunder the lost city of gold. Cheers, dove."
